Detailed Description

Class for operations on matrices.

Author:
BlackLight

double& grassmann::Matrix::operator() ( size_t  i,
size_t  j 
) throw (InvalidMatrixIndexException)

Re-definition of '()' operator to access the elements of a matrix.

To access the elements of a matrix you will use parenthesis. e.g.:

  Matrix A(2,2);
  A(0,0) = 1;
  A(0,1) = 0;
  A(1,0) = 0;
  A(1,1) = 1;

  for (size_t i=0; i < A.rows(); i++)  {
    for (size_t j=0; j < A.cols(); j++)
      cout << A(i,j) << " ";
    cout << endl;
  }

 
Parameters:

  

    
i Index of the row
 

    
j Index of the column
 

  




Returns:
A reference to the element at pos (i,j)
 


Exceptions:

  

    
InvalidMatrixIndexException If trying to access an index outside of the matrix

Matrix grassmann::Matrix::validate (  )  throw (NullMatrixDiagException)

Tries to validate a matrix (i.e.

removing eventual null rows or column or linear dependent rows or columns)

Returns:
Reference to the validated matrix
Exceptions:
NullMatrixDiagException If the matrix has null elements along the diagonal and they can't be reduced

Matrix grassmann::Matrix::validate ( int &  steps  )  throw (NullMatrixDiagException)

Tries to validate a matrix (i.e.

removing eventual null rows or column or linear dependent rows or columns)

Parameters:
steps Reference to an integer that will contain the number of iterations made to get a valid matrix
Returns:
Reference to the validated matrix
Exceptions:
NullMatrixDiagException If the matrix has null elements along the diagonal and they can't be reduced

Matrix grassmann::Matrix::validate ( Vector &  v  )  throw (NullMatrixDiagException)

Tries to validate a matrix (i.e.

removing eventual null rows or column or linear dependent rows or columns) to be used to solve a linear system, so all the swaps applied to the matrix are also applied to the vector of coefficients of the system

Parameters:
v Reference to the vector of system's coefficients
Returns:
Reference to the validated matrix
Exceptions:
NullMatrixDiagException If the matrix has null elements along the diagonal and they can't be reduced

Matrix triang ( Matrix  m  )  throw (NullMatrixDiagException) [friend]

Returns a triangular matrix associated to our matrix through Gauss' method.

To be done if and only if the matrix is not singular, else an exception will be raised

Parameters:
m Matrix to triangularize
Returns:
Reference to the triangularized matrix
Exceptions:
NullMatrixDiagException If the matrix has null elements along the diagonal and they can't be reduced
